template.name: SSL Cert Check External
template.description: Remember to replace the Macro default vlaue 00:18:BA:DF:OO:D0:A7:00:DE:AD:00:BE:EF:00:OF:F1:CE:00:CA:FE with the correct thumbprint.

item.name: SSL certificate thumbprint
item.description: Having the serial number of hte certificate helps when checking for revocation

item.name: SSL certificate Primary Certificate Name
item.description: Find the primary certificate name, e.g. www.example.com. Helps with confirming installed certificate is valid

item.name: SSL certificate serial
item.description: Having the serial number of hte certificate helps when checking for revocation

item.name: SSL certificate SANs
item.description:
Find any Subject alternate Names of the SSL cert, e.g. cms.example.com. Helps with confirming installed certificate is valid
Why -x parameter...? Because -s is for serial and e(x)tra valid names.

item.name: bc package
item.description: if this file does not exist then we can not check SSL validity

item.name: cut package
item.description: if cutl is not installed then we cannot check SSL certificates.

item.name: openssl package
item.description:
if openssl is not installed then we cannot check SSL certificates.
TODO: Can we use LibreSSL instead?

item.name: zext_ssl_cert.sh exists
item.description: if this file does not exist then we can not check SSL certificates

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has incorrect zext_ssl_cert.sh installed
trigger.description: If /usr/lib/zabbix/externalscripts/zext_ssl_cert.sh version is wrong then throw an alert

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no /usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh installed
trigger.description: If /usr/binzext_ssl_cert.sh does not exist this will throw an alert

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no bc package installed
trigger.description: Throw an alert if command line calculator bc is not installed

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no cut package installed
trigger.description: Throw an alert if cut is not installed

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no openssl package installed
trigger.description: Throw an alert if command line calculator bc is not installed

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} using StartCom Certificate REVIEW IMMEDIATELY
trigger.description: Per https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/StartCom are not allowed to issue certificates any more, so any nodes using them are verboten.

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} using WoSign Certificate REVIEW IMMEDIATELY
trigger.description: Per https://wiki.mozilla.org/CA:WoSign_Issues WoSign are not allowed to issue certificates any more, so any nodes using them are verboten.

trigger.name: SSL certificate for {$SSLURL} expires in less than 7 days ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} remaining)

dependency.name: SSL certificate for {$SSL_URL} expires in less than 5 days ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} remaining)

trigger.name: SSL certificate for {$SSL_URL} expired
SSL certificate for {$SSL_URL} expires in less than 3 days ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} remaining)

dependency.name: SSL certificate for {$SSL_URL} expires tomorrow ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} remaining)

trigger.name: SSL certificate for {$SSL_URL} expires in less than 5 days ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} remaining)

dependency.name: SSL certificate for {$SSL_URL} expires in less than 3 days ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} remaining)

trigger.name: SSL certificate for {$SSL_URL} expires in less than 14 days ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} remaining)

dependency.name: SSL certificate for {$SSLURL} expires in less than 7 days ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} remaining)

trigger.name: SSL certificate for {$SSL_URL} expires tomorrow ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} remaining)
SSL certificate for {$SSL_URL} is valid for more than 10 years ({ITEM.LASTVALUE}) likely self-signed

dependency.name: SSL certificate for {$SSLURL} expires in less than 7 days ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} remaining)

trigger.name: {$SSL_URL} CA changed to {ITEM.LASTVALUE} please investigate
trigger.description:
If the Certificate Issuer changes, we want to know about it, otherwise something like this will happen:
https://www.schrauger.com/the-story-of-how-wosign-gave-me-an-ssl-certificate-for-github-com

trigger.expression: {SSL Cert Check External:vfs.file.exists[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh].last(0)}=1 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(Buypass Class 3 CA 2)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(CloudFlare Inc ECC CA-2)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(COMODO RSA Extended Validation Secure Server CA)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(DigiCert SHA2 Extended Validation Server CA)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(DigiCert SHA2 Secure Server CA)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(Entrust Certification Authority - L1K)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(Entrust Certification Authority - L1M)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(GeoTrust TLS RSA CA G1)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(GlobalSign CloudSSL CA - SHA256 - G3)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(Go Daddy Secure Certificate Authority - G2)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(Google Internet Authority G3)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(Let's Encrypt Authority X3)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(Microsoft IT TLS CA 5)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(Network Solutions EV Server CA 2)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(Starfield Secure Certificate Authority - G2)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(Startcom)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(SwissSign EV Gold CA 2014 - G22)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(TeleSec ServerPass Class 2 CA)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str("Trustwave Extended Validation SHA256 CA, Level 1/emailAddress=ca@trustwave.com")}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(WoSign CA)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(WoTrus EV SSL Pro CA)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(COMODO RSA Domain Validation Secure Server CA)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str(Let's Encrypt Authority X3)}=0
trigger.name: {$SSL_URL} certificate has unknown CA {ITEM.LASTVALUE} (maybe self-signed)
trigger.description:
This is a partial list of CAs. But per https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Certificate_authority with a few obviouso nes such as Microsoft, Godaddy and Starfield (123REG) too. This is a list one would add to, not remove from.
Invalid CAs would go into the WoSign trigger after cloning it to be a new item in its own right.
The initial check is so we do not generate spurious alerts if the script is not installed

trigger.expression: {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -i {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].str("Default Issuer (Do not trust), O=Hewlett-Packard Company, OU=ISS, L=Houston, ST=Texas, C=US")}=1
trigger.name: {$SSL_URL} is using a Self-signed HP Certificate!
trigger.description: HP Self-Signed Certificate, throw an alert based on that.

trigger.name: {$SSL_URL} is using a Self-signed Parallels Panel Certificate
trigger.description: HP Self-Signed Certificate, throw an alert based on that.

trigger.name: {$SSL_URL} SHA1SUM of SSL cert does not match expected value

trigger.expression: {SSL Cert Check External:vfs.file.exists[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh].last(0)}=1 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run[/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -s {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}].diff(0)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run["/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -t {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}"].last(0)}=0 and {SSL Cert Check External:system.run["/usr/local/bin/zext_ssl_cert.sh -d {$SSL_URL} {$SSL_PORT}"].diff(0)}=1
trigger.name: {$SSL_URL} SSL serial {ITEM.LASTVALUE} has not changed despite certificate change
trigger.description:
If the Certificate serial number does not change, we want to know about it, otherwise something like this will happen:
https://wiki.mozilla.org/CA:WoSign_Issues#Issue_H:_Duplicate_Serial_Numbers_.28Apr_2015.29 and https://crt.sh/?serial=056d1570da645bf6b44c0a7077cc6769&iCAID=1662
Serial numbers are supposed to change when certificates do.

trigger.name: {$SSL_URL} Thumbprint changed to {ITEM.LASTVALUE} confirm this is expected
trigger.description: When updatign certs, this triggers an alert. Ensure tht this is expected, as changes outwith those periods are not good.
